It cheers on friends. If its friends are losing, its body lets off more and more sparks.
_____ loves to cheer on its partner in battle. It gives off sparks from its body while it is doing so. If its partner is in trouble, this Pokémon gives off increasing amounts of sparks.
_____ is more concerned about cheering on its partners than its own safety. It shorts out the electricity in its body to create brilliant showers of sparks to cheer on its teammates.
Exposure to electricity from _____ and Plusle promotes blood circulation and relaxes muscles.
At a meeting of Pokémon academics, it was announced that simultaneous exposure to electricity from a Plusle and _____ will promote circulation and boost vitality.
Its dislike of water makes it take shelter under the eaves of houses in rain. It uses pom-poms made of sparks for cheering.
